ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to write longer memoir/essay chapters and focus on getting as many insights/anecdotes on the page before I structure my piece.

In this course, I had to produce a work far beyond the scope of my experience and my ability. Because of that, I learned a tonabout fiction structure, about character, about sharing work, about deadlines, about a ton of other things. In the short timeframe of a single semester, it's difficult to produce a work that feels like a culmination of your academic experience. I don't think I succeeded in doing that. But I'm proud, with caveats, of the manuscript I submitted, and I learned a lot from being dissatisfied with it for so long.
I created and curated a collection of short stories I was proud of.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: One-on-one feedback with Sarah was always a pleasure. I like how each week my ideas for the memoir project changed. I'm grateful for our teamwork this semester!

The course depends greatly on the advisor and the student, so I don't know if my experience was universal. But I would have benefitted from more meetingsboth with my advisor and with the other concentrators. A weekly commitment would have made it feel more like the intensive program it was. Otherwise, though, I think things were generally well done.
I would have loved to read previous projects as a resource / a better outline of expectations.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Such a privilege and gift to have this time to tinker with one's writing, which is not just a semester's work, but a lifework.
Yes, I would. If you're considering doing it, you probably should.
Yes! This is your creative writing thesis so if youre here then you want to do this teehee. Its really wonderful to have a semester to dedicate to your work.
Writing my senior project was my most fulfilling academic achievement. I couldn't recommend this enough.
